page.title: 19Roman remains
page.content: Roman remains have been found on both sides of the River Medway.A Roman villa is now being excavated at Snodland. Many walls have been uncovered and small items of interest found. Evidence of burials have been found locally .In 1954 a barrow known as the Knob at Holborough was investigated. Many of the interesting finds are now kept at Maidstone Museum. On the opposite bank of the river other Roman finds include underground storage tunnels at Burham and various dwelling places. Finds from other periods are found sometimes.Earlier this year a Bronze Age skeleton was discovered in a chalk quarry at Halling.Saxon and Medieval remains have also been unearthed at different times in the locality.
